author: pietjepuk
content: If a proposer does not perform its duty (slot not filled with block), I assume the execution clients do not update their head block right? A missed block then also doesn't have any effect on the base fee?

author: potuz
content: This is my understanding as well

author: pietjepuk
content: I was thinking initially it would be kinda nice to have a doubly sized block after a validator misses its proposal, but no such luck I guess

author: potuz
content: Wouldn't this provide a strong incentive to eclipse your proposal?

author: potuz
content: Well I suppose it's always good for the next proposer to have the previous one failing to propose :)

author: enriavil1
content: Hello. in issue #3434 a person named sharon-wang had a bug that the letters in https://ethereum.org/en/eth2/vision/ at the section of 'the challenge of decentralised trading' , which cut off the words 'Decentralization' and when pressed it also cut off 'Scalability.' This happened in her linux machine in the brave browser. I believe to have solved this issue using padding on the words of 0.5rem, but I am unsure, since I cant test it myself. Joshua Minimalsm and I tried recreating it, but we couldnt in both of our devices. I have committed and pushed my code into a fork, but I am wondering if people could test it. If the cut out words still happen I am planing on increasing the width of the SVG as that should solve the issue too.

author: protolambda
content: <@!458053965423312910> thanks for the report, but this is not the right channel for it. ~~Please submit a bug report to https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website by opening a new issue, thanks~~ There's already an issue. Just comment on that, not here

author: enriavil1
content: I have. Sorry but I just want to ask someone to try it out so I could put it for review in the merge. Is there a channel for that?

author: protolambda
content: <@!485238712415027221> and others maintain the website, they can help. Others here are focused on different things of the Merge

author: enriavil1
content: okay thank you very. I am sorry I am new to the discord
